meta.description: Compare Saturn and Healthchecks.io: Saturn adds anomaly detection, health scoring, Kubernetes Helm chart, WordPress plugin, and advanced analytics.

hero.headline: Saturn vs Healthchecks.io
hero.subheadline: Enterprise-grade monitoring with anomaly detection and platform-native integrations

differences.title: Proactive Anomaly Detection
differences.saturn: Automatic statistical baseline after ≥10 runs. Alerts when duration exceeds mean + 3σ, catching performance degradation days before failure.
differences.healthchecks: Reactive only. Alerts when jobs miss or fail, but won't detect a job that slows from 10 seconds to 50 seconds over weeks.

differences.title: Health & Reliability Metrics
differences.saturn: Every monitor gets a health score (0-100, A-F) based on uptime, incidents, and consistency. Org dashboard shows rankings, trends, and SLA-ready reports.
differences.healthchecks: Simple up/down status. No aggregated metrics or health scoring for executive reporting.

differences.title: Enterprise-Ready Features
differences.saturn: RBAC with 3 roles, audit logs, maintenance windows with RRULE support, advanced alert routing, and dedicated customer success.
differences.healthchecks: Basic team access. Designed for small teams and individuals, not enterprise compliance requirements.

differences.title: Platform-Native Integrations
differences.saturn: Kubernetes Helm chart (zero-code sidecar), WordPress plugin (agency-scale management), advanced Slack integration (OAuth, threads, slash commands).
differences.healthchecks: Generic webhooks. Manual instrumentation required for Kubernetes. No WordPress-specific tools.

when_to_choose.headline: Which Tool Is Right for You?

scenarios.title: Choose Saturn If...
points: You need anomaly detection to catch slow jobs before they fail
You want health scoring and SLA reporting for stakeholders
You're running Kubernetes CronJobs and want zero-code monitoring
You manage WordPress sites at scale (agencies)
You need RBAC, audit logs, and enterprise features
You want advanced analytics (MTTR, MTBF, percentiles)

scenarios.title: Choose Healthchecks.io If...
points: You need simple ping monitoring without advanced analytics
You want self-hosted open source (Healthchecks is OSS)
You have a small number of checks (<20) and budget is tight
You don't need team features or integrations beyond webhooks

faq.question: Is Saturn more expensive than Healthchecks?
faq.answer: Saturn Pro ($29/mo for 50 monitors) is slightly more than Healthchecks Pro ($20/mo for 100 checks), but includes anomaly detection, health scoring, MTTR/MTBF, and platform integrations. Most teams find the value justifies the cost.

faq.question: Can I self-host Saturn?
faq.answer: Not currently. Saturn is cloud-only (SaaS). If self-hosting is a requirement, Healthchecks.io is open source. We're exploring enterprise self-hosted options for 2026.

faq.question: Does Saturn support as many alert channels as Healthchecks?
faq.answer: Saturn supports Email, Slack, Discord, and Webhooks. Healthchecks has more integrations (PagerDuty, Matrix, etc.). However, Saturn's webhooks with HMAC signatures make it easy to integrate with any service.

faq.question: Will my ping URLs change?
faq.answer: Yes. Saturn uses `https://api.saturn.example.com/api/ping/<MONITOR_ID>/success` format. You'll need to update your cron jobs or use the Saturn CLI wrapper.
